articles.description: Shubman Gill scores a superb unbeaten century as India begin their Champions Trophy campaign with victory over Bangladesh.

articles.description: A man who handed a letter to Emma Raducanu and "exhibited fixated behaviour" towards her has been given a restraining order, Dubai Police have confirmed.
articles.title: Emma Raducanu: Letter sparked Dubai incident where man was detained by police

articles.description: Spain's former football federation boss has been found guilty of kissing player Jenni Hermoso without her consent and ordered to pay a fine of more than €10,000.
articles.title: Spain former football boss Luis Rubiales fined for kissing player

articles.description: Jamie Smith will take the gloves and bat at number three in England's Champions Trophy opener against Australia on Saturday.

articles.description: After his miss against Aston Villa proved costly for Premier League leaders Liverpool, just how wasteful Darwin Nunez is?
articles.title: Darwin Nunez scoring stats: Is Liverpool striker's wastefulness costing Arne Slot's title hopefuls?

articles.description: Scotland fly-half Finn Russell has been declared fit to start Saturday's Six Nations match against England, but Darcy Graham is not involved in the matchday 23.
articles.title: Six Nations 2025: Scotland's Finn Russell fit to face England but Darcy Graham out

articles.description: Manchester City's tame Champions League surrender to Real Madrid marks the end of an era, says BBC Sport chief football writer Phil McNulty.
articles.title: Champions League: 'Manchester City's surrender in the Bernabeu is the end of an era'

articles.description: World number two Iga Swiatek falls to a shock defeat by Russian teenager Mirra Andreeva in the Dubai Tennis Championships quarter-finals.
articles.title: Iga Swiatek stunned by 17-year-old Mirra Andreeva in Dubai quarter-finals

articles.title: Dubois v Parker: Champion can reach heights of Fury & Joshua, says Fabio Wardley
